Community Gardens: With supermarkets closed, communities could come together to create their own gardens, sharing resources and knowledge to grow their own food. Confidence Score: 0.8
Online Marketplaces: Utilizing online platforms, people could purchase food directly from local farmers and producers, cutting out intermediaries and supporting local economies. Confidence Score: 0.9

Urban Foraging: By exploring and utilizing the edible resources available in urban environments, such as wild herbs, fruits, and vegetables, people could obtain food without relying on traditional supermarkets. Confidence Score: 0.8
Food Co-ops: Forming cooperatives where members pool their resources to purchase food in bulk, reducing costs and supporting local producers. Confidence Score: 0.9
Bartering and Trading: Creating a network of individuals exchanging goods and services, including food, based on mutual agreements and bartering. Confidence Score: 0.7
